data.title: Open Source Cloud Computing Infrastructure
data.meta_description: OpenStack is an open source cloud computing infrastructure software project and is one of the three most active open source projects in the world.
data.text:
The Most Widely Deployed Open Source Cloud Software in the World

Deployed by thousands. Proven production at scale. OpenStack is a set of software components that provide common services for cloud infrastructure.

OpenStack is developed by the community. For the community. Learn how to contribute

Cloud Infrastructure for Virtual Machines, Bare Metal, and Containers

Openstack controls large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources, all managed through APIs or a dashboard.

Beyond standard infrastructure-as-a-service functionality, additional components provide orchestration, fault management and service management amongst other services to ensure high availability of user applications.

Marketplace Spotlight

The OpenStack Marketplace is filled with experts working across industries, use cases, and regions to help your organization achieve your goals.

Animbus Remotely Managed Private Cloud offers a pay-as-you-go model cloud service in an isolated infrastructure to our clients. With our managed services, you are able to focus on your main business without worrying about your cloud infrastructure.

OpenInfra Foundation Member Spotlight

City Network, a leading global supplier of cloud services based on OpenStack, announced a new and updated version of its cloud management system for its City Cloud infrastructure service.

The cloud management system is built with the latest technology which allows for responsiveness and ease of use. By unifying access to all functionality available in City Cloud it is now easier than ever to manage resources across City Cloud locations for data residency purposes, whether running containers or just storing data in object storage.
